page.title: 16HAMPTON FARM AND HAMPTON
page.content: Hampton Farm has been in the Coleing family for three generations.The family own 491 acres,which includes two acres of deciduous woodland.Mr. Coleing owns 8 tractors and one combine harvester.He has 6 helpers and his Dad works part-time.The farm itself is mixed farming but mostly cattle and sheep.There are 85 milking cows,1 cow calving,16 incalf heifers,1 Hereford bull,28 cows between one and two years old,14 dairy heifers,26 female and 11 bull calves and 4 small females.All together there are 192.The cows produce 57100 litres of milk in a year.Mr.Coleing also has two horses, 103 ewes,160 lambs and some rams. Hampton itself is a small hamlet near Highworth.It has a population of 48. There are no shops and no bus services.Most people have their own transport.
